About Me

Some Description

BIO

I am a final-year Bachelor of Science student majoring in Computer Science at the University of Auckland. I find it fascinating how ideas and services can be translated into accessible software, enabling users to have a smooth and rewarding experience. I have a strong passion for coding and am fascinated by the vast potential of software development, from creating algorithms to building applications.

Overview of Skills

From my unviersity studies, I have learnt the programming languages Python, Java, HTML, CSS and the Flask framework.

Python Solitare

The aim of this project was to create graphics and come up with a creative way to showcase my program 'Solitaire', without the use of third party python libraries. I had to do my own research as to how to create graphics using Turtle graphics and Tkinter through informative websites and YouTube videos. I discovered how to change the direction, colour, size and speed of the turtle to create shape and create widgets such as buttons and texts using Tkinter

Java Bouncing Applicaiton

For this project, using the Java oracle documentation was very helpful for debugging my code. The project included concepts such as object orientated programming, polymorphism, abstract classes, interfaces and Java GUI programming. The aim was to create a program where the user can add shapes that move across the screen, including nested shapes (i.e. a shape within another shape)
